resources.string: Back in Time - Widgets and Watch Faces
Adding a widget to the Home Screen
Adding a widget to the Lock Screen
Changing the Watchface of your wearable
This application provides Home Screen and Lock Screen widgets for Android phones and tablets, as well as Watchfaces for Android Wear watches, based on the "Back to the Future" movies.

1. Navigate to your Home Screen. You might want to go to a page where there\'ll be enough space to put the widget.
2. Open the Apps draw and select the Widgets tab.
3. Find the Time Circuits or the Clock Tower widget.
4. Press and hold on it.
5. Place it on the Home Screen and let go. As you release it, you\'ll see a white frame around it, as well as circles indicating that you can change the size of the widget.

1. Lock your device to show the Lock Screen.
2. Swipe from the left edge of the device to the right edge, until you reveal a big + sign in a white rectangle.
3. Tap the “+” sign to see a list of available lock-screen widgets. If your phone is protected by a passcode, you\’ll need to enter it first before you can browse your available widgets.
3. Find the Time Circuits or the Clock Tower widget.
4. Tap on it to add it to the Lock Screen.

1. Navigate to the Wear device\'s Settings. You can do that by bringing the Google Now screen and then saying "Settings", or scrolling down to see the Settings option.
2. In the Settings page, scroll down to the "Change watch face" option 3. Tap the “+” sign to see a list of available lock-screen widgets. If your phone is protected by a passcode, you\’ll need to enter it first before you can browse your available widgets.
3. Find the Time Circuits or the Clock Tower widget.
4. Tap on it to add it to the Lock Screen.
